newsitem.title: NORWAY: RALLYING-SPECTATOR KILLED AT NORWEGIAN RALLY.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING-SPECTATOR KILLED AT NORWEGIAN RALLY.

text.p: A spectator was hit by a car and killed during a motor rally near Kongsvinger in southeastern Norway early on Saturday, the national news agency NTB said.
The man, an unidentified 22-year-old, died instantly when he was hit by a racing car on a forest road during the annual Rally Finnskog Norway event, the report said.
Organisers said the driver was a Norwegian but his name was not immediately made available.
"This stage covered 28 kilometres and we can't keep guards everywhere on the road," a spokesman for the rally said.
A final stage planned for Saturday was cancelled because of the accident, which was the first fatal incident in Norwegian rally race history, NTB said.
It said police were investigating the accident.
The race began on Friday and had 165 participants from northern Europe.
